channel.title: Parents...Computer usage...etc
channel.description: I am 13 years old, and I'm on the computer for most of my day, this tends to annoy my mom to no end. She is constantly bothering me to "Get off" and "do something else" etc. It's not like I'm overweight, nor is it like I just talk mindlessly on MSN all day, I program, work on websites, read ebooks, and make a fool out of myself by suggesting the usage of a struct in a Java program. Regardless of what I do, it is seen as "sitting in a chair" and "staring at a screen". I do a physical work out every day, yet it also seems to count for nothing. I once got into a debate with my mom, which ended up with the conclusion that the only way she would ever be happy is if I did nothing but exercise. Just proves how very little she thinks about this matter -.- How can I convince my mom that working on the computer isn't a bad thing, and that a lot of arguments will be avoided if she just leaves me alone?

item.title: Parents...Computer usage...etc
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:4, topic:136713”]Does your mother ever use the computer? If so, install a rootkit or something on her account, and then when she can’t get it to work fix it for her and tell her that she doesn’t appreciate how much you know about computers.

Or just buy a set of earplugs.[/quote]
Nah, I’ve fixed her computer before, she understands not every 13 year old knows how to program, but it’s just constant “GET OFF” and then she forces me to endure the utterly pointless activities, otherwise known as shopping and hiking to the middle of a field.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents...Computer usage...etc
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Maybe you should ‘get off’ like she says.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents...Computer usage...etc
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Does your mother ever use the computer? If so, install a rootkit or something on her account, and then when she can’t get it to work fix it for her and tell her that she doesn’t appreciate how much you know about computers.

Or just buy a set of earplugs.

item.title: Parents...Computer usage...etc
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Tbh, If I was your mom, I’d put my foot through your computer.
Get out, and go play.

Computers will always be there, but life will not.

Read full topic

find one of those fake online articles
